<@UGY22E2KC> I don't know if it plays any role really but `hreflang` and `alternate` can be added to sitemap as instructed by Google too (<https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/189077#sitemap|here> and <https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/183668#general-guidelines|here>).

The first link mentions that having those tags in HTML _is useful if you don't have a sitemap or the ability to specify HTTP response headers for your site_ which to me sounds a little like having them in sitemap would be the preferred way, but that's just me guessing.
